title: Bypass Filter on link of build

profile.name: CS Money
profile.about: CS:GO trading platform that helps people to trade, buy, sell and search for the best skins and deals they could possibly find.

vulnerability_information:
## Summary:
Hello team, I found that a valid build will have a link with the following format

```
https://3d.cs.money/item/0UkWN8vh2R
```

If you save a build with `/api/build/save`. It will return a link to sync with your save builds
The bug occurs when web app sync, you can custom the link of build with whatever you want with the format 

```
//YOUR_LINK/item/WHAT_EVER_YOU_WANT
```

## Steps To Reproduce:
[add details for how we can reproduce the issue]

- Make a build. Save build. Intercept request sync
- Edit request sync. For example:

```
POST /sync HTTP/1.1
Host: 3d.cs.money
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:80.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/80.0
```

PoC
{F1002083}

## Impact

Bypass the format (regex?) on the link of  a build

activities.message:
Hey!
We can't see exact issue, you might need to describe the impact more.
As for now this issue would be working only on your account.
activities.markdown_message:
Hey!
We can't see exact issue, you might need to describe the impact more.
As for now this issue would be working only on your account.

activities.message:
This is not a real security issue. But the regex needs to fix before any future function use it and someone makes it work unintendedly

Thank you!
activities.markdown_message:
This is not a real security issue. But the regex needs to fix before any future function use it and someone makes it work unintendedly

Thank you!

activities.message:
I mean this is not a real security issue for now. 
But if I can make it works unintendedly now. In future, if any new function uses it, it may be real security!
Bypass the regex itself and break how it works not enough to give it a look huh?

Thank you!
activities.markdown_message:
I mean this is not a real security issue for now.
But if I can make it works unintendedly now. In future, if any new function uses it, it may be real security!

Thank you!

activities.message:
Hey!
We've discussed the issue.
Going to fix this. As far no security issue for now present, going to give this a low priority.

activities.message:
Hi @triage_team,

I just realized this bug can chain with #990878 to redirect your customer to any link attacker wants
